comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_Lear_(baseball) Charles Bernard "King" Lear (January 23, 1891 – October 31, 1976) was a professional baseball pitcher who played two seasons of Major League Baseball. He played for the Cincinnati Reds for 17 games during the 1914 Cincinnati Reds season and 40 games during the 1915 Cincinnati Reds season.
